org.openpoi.server.api
Interface Query

All Known Implementing Classes:
QueryImpl
public interface Query

Method Summary
 Set<Integer> getCategoryIds()
          POIs within a layer can be divided into categories, and each query specifies which categories are being queried.
 String getLayerName()

Method Detail

getLayerName

String getLayerName()
The name of the layer being queried, which is very important in the case where more than one layer use the same PoiManager class.

getWithin

com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry getWithin()
The geometry which the POIs should be within. This is normally a bounding box, although the interface allows arbitrary geometries.

getZoomLevel

int getZoomLevel()
An implementation may choose to only show a subset of the POIs for a certain zoom level, so the zoom level being queried is supplied.

getPoiIds

Set<Integer> getPoiIds()
Only POIs identified by the integer IDs in this collection should be returned to the client. An implementation may choose to ignore this, if it does not use identifiers for its POIs.

getCategoryIds

Set<Integer> getCategoryIds()
POIs within a layer can be divided into categories, and each query specifies which categories are being queried. The interface does not make any assumptions about how the categories are organized, except that each category must be possible to identify by a unique identifier. A PoiManager implementation is free to ignore the categories if it does not support them.

getText

String getText()
Allows an arbitrary text query to be specified. It is up to the implementation to filter the resulting POIs according to this text, if specified.
